body:
I followed the code path once to see if there's any easy way to fix it.

The `PUT` request for the multipart upload is triggered here.
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/743ea6ac263895fb0091df140bbb6c4e2196e97f/backend/onedrive/onedrive.go#L2239-L2248

`o.fs.srv` is an http client which is generated here.
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/743ea6ac263895fb0091df140bbb6c4e2196e97f/backend/onedrive/onedrive.go#L950-L966

`oauthutil.NewClient` internally calls `oauthutil.NewClientWithBaseClient`, which creates an `oauth2.NewClient` here.
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/743ea6ac263895fb0091df140bbb6c4e2196e97f/lib/oauthutil/oauthutil.go#L410-L422

The `oauth2` package uses a `RoundTrip` which always calls `token.SetAuthHeader` - that's where the `Authorization` header is set.
https://github.com/golang/oauth2/blob/6e9ec9323da7adcd2cc6e62e4deb9fae4c309a1a/token.go#L84-L86

All this to say: It does not look like there's an easy way to not set the `Authorization` header for the multipart upload request. Since it is always added by the `oauth2` transport, you'd need to conditially remove it from the request before sending it. A cleaner solution might be to just use a non-oauth http client to send these requests.

I wonder why this never fails in the integration tests? Maybe it needs very big files?

Anyway, @cetteup your idea of a unauthenticated client is easy to implement.

Please try this @chscott and @cetteup 

[v1.66.0-beta.7595.5841b1253.fix-7405-onedrive-upload](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-7405-onedrive-upload/v1.66.0-beta.7595.5841b1253.fix-7405-onedrive-upload/) on branch [fix-7405-onedrive-upload](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-7405-onedrive-upload) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

rename.from: Authorization header should not be included in PUT request for multipart upload
rename.to: onedrive: Authorization header should not be included in PUT request for multipart upload

body:
Thanks a lot for the fix! I tested it with the same sync job that I first noticed the issue with. With the old v1.65.0, it only created folders in OneDrive, I did not see a single file being uploaded. With v1.66.0-beta.7595.5841b1253.fix-7405-onedrive-upload, it uploaded files successfully.

Regarding the file size: It failed for me with rather small files. I see the "Failed to copy: unauthenticated: Unauthenticated" errors for files as small as 10-20MB in the logs.

One thing to note: Both versions seem to have issues cancelling multipart uploads. v1.66.0-beta.7595.5841b1253.fix-7405-onedrive-upload logs
> Failed to cancel multipart upload: unauthenticated: Unauthenticated (upload failed due to: \<nil\>)

v1.65.0 logs
> Failed to cancel multipart upload: unauthenticated: Unauthenticated (upload failed due to: unauthenticated: Unauthenticated)

May be a topic for another issue though, I haven't looked into that one (yet).

> Thanks a lot for the fix! I tested it with the same sync job that I first noticed the issue with. With the old v1.65.0, it only created folders in OneDrive, I did not see a single file being uploaded. With v1.66.0-beta.7595.5841b1253.fix-7405-onedrive-upload, it uploaded files successfully.

Great - thank you for testing.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.66 and v1.65.1
 
> Regarding the file size: It failed for me with rather small files. I see the "Failed to copy: unauthenticated: Unauthenticated" errors for files as small as 10-20MB in the logs.

Hmm... Well onedrive is complicated and has lots of differently aged parts and systems joined together so I guess the fact that some bits behave differently to others is not surprising!

> One thing to note: Both versions seem to have issues cancelling multipart uploads. v1.66.0-beta.7595.5841b1253.fix-7405-onedrive-upload logs
> 
> > Failed to cancel multipart upload: unauthenticated: Unauthenticated (upload failed due to: <nil>)
> 
> v1.65.0 logs
> 
> > Failed to cancel multipart upload: unauthenticated: Unauthenticated (upload failed due to: unauthenticated: Unauthenticated)
> 
> May be a topic for another issue though, I haven't looked into that one (yet).

Can you make another issue for this please? I want to merge this and get it into the point release which is out in a day or so so another issue would be appropriate - thank you!

```
rclone v1.66.0
- os/version: arch rolling (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.6.33-1-lts (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.22.1
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```

OneDrive Personal

I've tried to `rclone configure` and refresh token, but that didn't work. I was able to list files, delete file but couldn't open/read file. Mount works too but without reading files.

issue.title: Rclone Update for Rclone Bug

repository.name: resticker
repository.description: Run automatic restic backups via a Docker container.

issue.body:
Rclone had a bug with uploading OneDrive files. It was fixed in v1.66, see here: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/7405

Can you update the dockerfile to use rclone v 1.67.0? This will fix the onedrive unauthenticated upload issue.

issue.title: Update Rclone in Dockerfile

repository.name: resticker
repository.description: Run automatic restic backups via a Docker container.

issue.body:
There was a bug in rclone relating to onedrive that was fixed in v1.66, see here: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/7405

Can you update the dockerfile to use rclone v 1.67.0? This will fix an unauthenticated issue onedrive had when using rclone.

body:
It remained a error when needed to cancel the upload.

2024/12/28 10:04:23 NOTICE: haos/haos_ova-14.0.qcow2: Failed to cancel multipart upload: unauthenticated: Unauthenticated (upload failed due to: Put "https://my.microsoftpersonalcontent.com/personal/447b5ac1be1baeee/_api/v2.0/drives/(...)": can't copy - source file is being updated (mod time changed from 2024-12-28 10:03:52.254849716 -0300 -03 to 2024-12-28 10:04:19.911864003 -0300 -03))

Hi everybody, reached this thread googling for an answer...
Having similar issue here, but with different circunstancies, in my case I trying to configure in truenas. And also I have a different case, I use two accounts, one is mine. the other belongs to my wife. So, my account, thats linked to a @hotmail.com account works flawlessly, but my wife's account linked to @outlook.com, gives this error. 

So the differences between the accounts are:
1 - the liked e-mail, one is @hotmail.com, the other is @outlook.com
2 - My account is the "Master" account and my wife's account is "family member" that was invited
3 - At the creation of the "cloud account" in TrueNas, mine shows only one drive to connect, and my wife's shows four, beeing 2 different repeated 2 times each

I guess this 2 drivers could be the cause of the problem.... perhaps something related with the age of the account? Because mine is way much older... or could it be due to the association to @outllok.com?

As I still have 3 accounts left, i'm thinking in create another, associated with any other e-mail and see what happens...

Hi all, I came across this thread when searching for solutions to a similar problems. My rclone OneDrive is acting up. I can mount the drive and list files, but any read/write results in **ERROR : IO error: unauthenticated: Unauthenticated**

I have tried reconfig'd the drive, refresh tokens, update rclone to latest version 1.69, but still the same problem. FWIW my Google drive mount is working fine, so I guess this is specific to OneDrive? MSFT changed something in the backend?

@anvuongb I have the same issue starting from 1 week ago with my private OneDrive. 
However, Business OneDrive works fine. 

Tried reconfig, refreshed tokens, was already on latest rclone for Ubuntu apt. 

Downloaded rclone 1.69 using the script, and now it works.
@diblaze I don't know what's changed but it is now working for me too, I haven't changed anything since last time. Weird.
